episodeTitle: A Secret Strategy to Turn the Tables - Nightmare Luffy Appears
episodeTitleJapanese: 逆転への秘策 ナイトメア・ルフィ見参
episodeTitleRomanized: Gyakuten e no Hisaku - Naitomea Rufi Kenzan
description: The Straw Hats continue their desperate battle against the giant zombie Oars under Gecko Moria's control. Meanwhile, Luffy encounters the Rolling Pirates, who implant 100 shadows into him, creating the powerful but temporary Nightmare Luffy transformation.

events.title: Moria Takes Direct Control of Oars
events.description: Gecko Moria begins directly guiding Oars from within, allowing the massive zombie to counter the Straw Hats' strategies more effectively. Oars becomes significantly more dangerous with Moria's tactical guidance, turning the crew's attacks against them.
events.significance: This escalates the battle significantly, as Oars gains strategic intelligence to match his overwhelming physical power, putting the Straw Hats in greater danger.

events.title: Straw Hats Execute Coordinated Attacks
events.description: The Straw Hat crew launches coordinated combination attacks against Oars. Usopp and Franky combine their techniques into a fire attack, Chopper and Zoro collaborate on building destruction tactics, and Sanji launches powerful kicks at debris.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's teamwork and tactical coordination, though their attacks prove insufficient against Oars under Moria's control.

events.title: Franky's Failed Kuwagata Slingshot Attack
events.description: Franky attempts to fire himself at Oars using a giant slingshot called Kuwagata, planning to shoot the giant at point-blank range with Weapons Left. However, the attack fails and Franky is knocked unconscious by Oars, leaving him unable to continue fighting.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' desperation and willingness to use risky strategies, but also shows that even their most creative tactics are ineffective against Oars.

events.title: Nami Joins the Battle with Thunderbolt Tempo
events.description: Nami arrives to support her crewmates and unleashes a powerful Thunderbolt Tempo attack that shocks Oars badly, forcing the massive zombie to drop to his knees. Both Oars and Moria inside him are electrified by the attack.
events.significance: Shows Nami's combat capabilities and her ability to temporarily stun even the powerful Oars, providing a brief respite for her crew.

events.title: Oars Demonstrates Luffy's Stretching Abilities
events.description: To the crew's shock, Oars demonstrates that he can stretch his limbs like rubber, using Gomu Gomu no Pistol. The Straw Hats realize this is Moria's doing - because Oars has Luffy's shadow implanted in him, he can use Luffy's Devil Fruit abilities.
events.significance: Major revelation that shows Moria's shadow powers can transfer Devil Fruit abilities to zombies, making Oars even more dangerous by combining giant strength with rubber powers.

events.title: Oars Attacks Nami with Gomu Gomu no Pistol
events.description: Using the newly revealed stretching ability, Oars prepares a Gum-Gum Pistol and knocks Nami off the tower. Robin saves Nami from falling using her multiple arms, bringing the navigator safely down to her side.
events.significance: Demonstrates the danger of Oars having Luffy's abilities and showcases Robin's quick thinking in protecting her crewmate.

events.title: Luffy Meets the Rolling Pirates
events.description: Elsewhere on Thriller Bark, Luffy encounters the Rolling Pirates - a crew of pirates who have been trapped on the island after Gecko Moria stole their shadows. Led by their captain Charlotte Lola, they block Luffy's path in the forest.
events.significance: Introduces the Rolling Pirates and sets up the crucial alliance that will enable the Nightmare Luffy transformation.

events.title: Rolling Pirates Explain Shadow Implantation Technique
events.description: The Risky Brothers and Captain Lola explain to Luffy that they have discovered a crucial secret: multiple shadows can be inserted into one living body. When shadows are implanted into a living person, that person gains the skills and abilities of the shadows' original owners, though the effect only lasts for ten minutes.
events.significance: Reveals important mechanics of Moria's Kage Kage no Mi powers and establishes the theoretical basis for the Nightmare Luffy transformation.

events.title: First Shadow Implanted - Swordsman's Skills
events.description: The Rolling Pirates suddenly hold Luffy down and implant a single shadow into him. When they give him a sword, Luffy impressively slices through a tree trunk with skilled precision. They explain that this shadow once belonged to a strong swordsman, and Luffy has temporarily gained those skills.
events.significance: Demonstrates the shadow implantation process and proves that the technique works, setting up the much larger transformation to come.

events.title: Nightmare Luffy Transformation - 100 Shadows Implanted
events.description: The Rolling Pirates bring out all 100 shadows they have collected over three years and implant them all into Luffy simultaneously. Everyone is shocked by Luffy's immense willpower, as most people could never handle so many shadows at once. Luffy's body transforms dramatically - he grows much taller and more muscular, his skin turns pale blue, and his appearance becomes ghastly and zombie-like. Captain Lola names this form 'Nightmare Luffy.'
events.significance: This is the debut of one of the most unique and powerful temporary transformations in the series, representing Luffy's enormous willpower and the desperation needed to defeat Oars and Moria. This form appears nowhere else in One Piece canon.

quotes.text: There are now a total of 100 shadows in his body!
quotes.speaker: Rolling Pirates
quotes.context: Expressing amazement at Luffy's ability to absorb all 100 shadows

events.title: Ten Minute Time Limit Established
events.description: The Rolling Pirates warn that the shadow power-up will only last for ten minutes. After that time, all the shadows will leave Luffy's body and he will return to normal. This creates tremendous urgency for Luffy to reach Oars and Moria quickly.
events.significance: Establishes the critical time constraint that will drive the tension in the upcoming episodes and force Luffy to act decisively.

events.title: Nightmare Luffy Displays Overwhelming Strength
events.description: In his Nightmare Luffy form, Luffy demonstrates incredible physical strength that far surpasses his normal abilities. His power has increased so dramatically that he will soon be able to match and even overpower Oars, the legendary 'Continent Puller' giant who has been dominating the Straw Hat crew.
events.significance: Establishes Nightmare Luffy as the key to turning the tide against Oars and Moria, showing that this transformation provides the level of power needed to fight a giant zombie with Luffy's own abilities.

quotes.text: There are now a total of 100 shadows in his body!
quotes.speaker: Rolling Pirates
quotes.context: Marveling at Luffy's willpower to absorb all 100 shadows

themes.description: The episode showcases Luffy's extraordinary willpower as he successfully absorbs 100 shadows - something that would overwhelm most people. This demonstrates that mental strength is as important as physical strength.
themes.symbolism: The Nightmare Luffy transformation represents the extreme lengths the Straw Hats must go to in order to protect each other and achieve victory.

themes.description: Both the Straw Hats' coordinated attacks and their alliance with the Rolling Pirates emphasize the importance of working together to overcome seemingly impossible obstacles.
themes.symbolism: The Rolling Pirates giving their collected shadows to Luffy represents the trust and hope they place in him as their champion.

themes.description: The episode conveys the desperate situation the characters face, with Franky risking himself in a dangerous attack and the Rolling Pirates entrusting all their collected shadows to Luffy in one final gambit.
themes.symbolism: The temporary nature of Nightmare Luffy symbolizes that desperate measures often come with limitations and consequences.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his incredible willpower by absorbing 100 shadows and transforming into Nightmare Luffy, showing his determination to save his crew and defeat their enemies no matter what it takes.
keyActions: Meets the Rolling Pirates in Thriller Bark's forest
Absorbs first shadow and gains swordsman skills
Successfully absorbs all 100 shadows despite the strain
Prepares to confront Oars with ten-minute time limit

characterSpotlights.role: Supporting character - Allied captain making debut
characterSpotlights.development: Charlotte Lola debuts as the captain of the Rolling Pirates, showing leadership and strategic thinking by devising the plan to empower Luffy with shadows. She demonstrates trust in Luffy as their best hope to defeat Moria.
keyActions: Explains shadow implantation technique with the Risky Brothers
Oversees the implantation of 100 shadows into Luffy

characterSpotlights.development: Franky shows his willingness to use risky and creative tactics by attempting the Kuwagata slingshot attack, though he is ultimately defeated and knocked unconscious.
keyActions: Executes combination fire attack with Usopp
Attempts to fire himself at Oars using Kuwagata slingshot

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her combat prowess by joining the battle and successfully stunning Oars with her Thunderbolt Tempo, showing she can hold her own against powerful enemies.
keyActions: Arrives to support the crew in battle
Uses Thunderbolt Tempo to shock Oars and Moria
Gets knocked off tower by Oars' Gomu Gomu no Pistol

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the Straw Hats' combination attacks against Oars with additional animated sequences not detailed in the manga panels.
The shadow implantation process and Nightmare Luffy transformation are given more dramatic visual treatment in the anime with extended reaction shots.

trivia.fact: Episode 370 aired on September 14, 2008 in Japan and achieved a TV rating of 9.3%, ranking 5th in viewership that week.
Nightmare Luffy is one of the most unique transformations in One Piece, appearing only during the Thriller Bark arc and never again in the series canon.

sources.title: One Piece: Nightmare Luffy, Explained - Game Rant

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of Charlotte Lola, who would later be revealed as Big Mom's daughter and play an important role in the Whole Cake Island arc.
The episode adapts parts of Chapter 475 'Pirates of the Forest' and Chapter 476 'Nightmare Luffy' from the manga.
This episode uses 'Jungle P' by 5050 as its opening theme, which was the 9th opening of the series and the first to feature both the Thousand Sunny and Franky as an official crew member.
Charlotte Lola is voiced by Aya Hisakawa in Japanese and Alex Moore in the English Funimation dub.
